gw.api.financials

Class CurrencyAmount

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.financials.CurrencyAmount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMoney, IDimension<S,T>, ISequenceable<E,S,U>, GWRemotable, Comparable<T>

    public class CurrencyAmount
extends Object
implements IMoney, GWRemotable, IDimension<S,T>, Comparable<T>, ISequenceable<E,S,U>
    Represents a monetary amount with a currency.

    CurrencyAmounts can be used in two "modes". "Strict" CurrencyAmounts require a currency, and further require that their amounts have a scale appropriate for their currency. An attempt to create a "strict" CurrencyAmount ({@link #getStrict(java.math.BigDecimal, gw.pl.currency.typekey.Currency)} either with a null currency, or with a value that cannot be set to the currency scale without rounding, will fail.

    "Non-strict" CurrencyAmounts can have any scale and have an optional currency. This mode exists primarily for backwards-compatibility. The methods that operate in "non-strict" mode have been deprecated. In Gosu, mathematical operators (e.g., +) can be used with CurrencyAmounts, and CurrencyAmounts are interchangeable with {@link java.math.BigDecimal}s. These operations all occur in "non-strict" mode. That is, the results of these operations should be considered "non-strict" CurrencyAmounts.

    This class contains many methods that exist on {@link java.math.BigDecimal}, in deprecated form. This is because in prior versions, CurrencyAmount extended {@link java.math.BigDecimal}. Now, it composes a {@link java.math.BigDecimal} and a {@link gw.pl.currency.typekey.Currency}.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      BigDecimal Amount
      The BigDecimal amount of the CurrencyAmount. This property will not return null.
      Currency Currency
      The Currency typekey of this CurrencyAmount.
      static Comparator<CurrencyAmount> NULL_SAFE_CURRENCY_THEN_AMOUNT_COMPARATOR
      A CurrencyAmount comparator based on the following rules: - Nulls are treated as less than all other values. - If two CurrencyAmounts have different Currencies, then uses their Currency priority values for comparison. Otherwise, uses their amount values (BigDecimals) for comparison.

      CurrencyAmount add(CurrencyAmount amount)
      Add amount.getAmount() to this.getAmount()
      CurrencyAmount addAsSameCurrency(BigDecimal amount, MathContext mc)
      Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23), mc) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency(), mc)
      CurrencyAmount addAsSameCurrency(BigDecimal amount)
      Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23)) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency())
      CurrencyAmountPair addSecondaryMoneyComponent(Currency secondaryCurrency)
      Calculates the equivalent of this CurrencyAmount in the secondaryCurrency, and returns a new CurrencyAmount with that secondary CurrencyAmount as the SecondaryMoneyComponent. Does nothing if this.Currency and the secondaryCurrency are equal or null
      CurrencyAmountPair addSecondaryMoneyComponent(Currency secondaryCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRate)
      Calculates the equivalent of this CurrencyAmount in the secondaryCurrency with the given exchangeRate, and returns a new CurrencyAmount with that secondary CurrencyAmount as the SecondaryMoneyComponent. Does nothing if this.Currency and the secondaryCurrency are equal or null
      CurrencyAmount addStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
      Calculates this + amount. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
      static int compare(CurrencyAmount amount1, CurrencyAmount amount2)
      Compares two money amounts, which may be null. Null money amounts are ordered before non-null money amounts.

      Otherwise, the currency amounts are compared according to {@link #compareTo(CurrencyAmount)} .
      int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount o)
      Compares this currency amount with another, which may be of a different currency. If both currency amounts specify a currency, and the currencies are different, then the given currency amount is converted into this currency amount's currency before the amounts are compared. The conversion is based on current market exchange rates and the result is rounded using the default rounding mode.

      After possible conversion, the currency amounts are compared according to {@link #compareTo(CurrencyAmount)} .
      static int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount amount1, CurrencyAmount amount2)
      Compares two money amounts, which may be null. Null money amounts are ordered before non-null money amounts.

      Otherwise, the currency amounts are compared according to {@link #compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount)} .
      int compareTo(CurrencyAmount o)
      Compares this currency amount with another by comparing their numeric amounts. If both currency amounts specify a currency, then the currencies must be the same.

      See {@link java.lang.Comparable#compareTo} for an explanation of the int return value.
      CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Converts this CurrencyAmount into one in the given currency, according to the current market exchange rate, with the resulting amount rounded according to the given rounding mode.

      If either currency is null, or if the currencies are the same, returns this instance.
      CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRateOverride, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Converts this CurrencyAmount into one in the given currency, according to the given exchange rate, with the resulting amount rounded according to the given rounding mode.

      If either currency is null, or if the currencies are the same, returns this instance.
      boolean currenciesEqual(CurrencyAmount curAmt2)
      Returns true if Currency of given CurrencyAmount equals this Currency, or either is null.

      boolean equals(Object o)
      Two CurrencyAmounts are considered equal if the currencies are the same and the amounts are equal.
      CurrencyAmount fix(RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency, and the currency set to the default currency if null. The amount is rounded according to the given rounding mode.
      static CurrencyAmount getStrict(BigDecimal amount, Currency currency)
      Constructs a CurrencyAmount from a BigDecimal amount and currency. The currency parameter cannot be null. The amount will be scaled as appropriate for the given currency, and the amount must not have more decimal digits than that scale allows. Use {@link CurrencyUtil#roundToCurrencyScale} in preference to this method if rounding is required when scaling the BigDecimal. For example, if it is the result of a divide or multiply operation.

      CurrencyAmount setScaleToCurrency()
      Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency. No rounding is allowed.

      Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency. The amount is rounded according to the given rounding mode.

      Since a CurrencyAmount is immutable, this will return a new CurrencyAmount with the secondary component set if the current secondaryComponent and passed-in one are not equal.

      CurrencyAmount subtractStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
      Subtracts two CurrencyAmounts. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
      CurrencyAmount toCurrencyAmount()
      Converts this IMoney into a CurrencyAmount. Returns null if this IMoney's Amount is null. Otherwise, returns a CurrencyAmount whose amount and currency are equal to this IMoney's.
      String toString()
      Formats this currency amount as <amount>[<SPACE><currency>].
      static CurrencyAmount valueOf(IMoney money)
      Returns a {@link gw.api.financials.CurrencyAmount} whose amount and currency are equivalent to the given money. Returns null if either money or money.getAmount() is null.

      • compareMultiCurrency

        int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount o)
        Compares this currency amount with another, which may be of a different currency. If both currency amounts specify a currency, and the currencies are different, then the given currency amount is converted into this currency amount's currency before the amounts are compared. The conversion is based on current market exchange rates and the result is rounded using the default rounding mode.

        After possible conversion, the currency amounts are compared according to {@link #compareTo(CurrencyAmount)} .

        Parameters:
        o -
        Returns:

      • setSecondaryMoneyComponent

        CurrencyAmountPair setSecondaryMoneyComponent(CurrencyAmount secondaryMoneyComponent)
        Since a CurrencyAmount is immutable, this will return a new CurrencyAmount with the secondary component set if the current secondaryComponent and passed-in one are not equal.
        Parameters:
        secondaryMoneyComponent -
        Returns:

      • signum

        int signum()
        Returns the sign of this CurrencyAmount.
        Returns:
        -1, 0, or 1 as the value of this CurrencyAmount is negative, zero, or positive.

        Subtract amount.getAmount() from this.getAmount()
        Parameters:

      • subtractAsSameCurrency

        CurrencyAmount subtractAsSameCurrency(BigDecimal amount)
        Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23)) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency())
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Returns:
        A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

      • subtractAsSameCurrency

        CurrencyAmount subtractAsSameCurrency(BigDecimal amount,
                                    MathContext mc)
        Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23), mc) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency(), mc)
        Parameters:
        amount -
        mc -
        Returns:
        A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount, mc) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

      • subtractStrict

        CurrencyAmount subtractStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
        Subtracts two CurrencyAmounts. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
        Parameters:
        amount -
        Returns:
        a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.

      • valueOf

        CurrencyAmount valueOf(IMoney money)
        Returns a {@link gw.api.financials.CurrencyAmount} whose amount and currency are equivalent to the given money. Returns null if either money or money.getAmount() is null.
        Parameters:
        money -
        Returns:

      • setScaleToCurrency

        CurrencyAmount setScaleToCurrency()
        Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency. No rounding is allowed.
        Returns:

      • setScaleToCurrency

        CurrencyAmount setScaleToCurrency(RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency. The amount is rounded according to the given rounding mode.
        Parameters:
        roundingMode -
        Returns:
